meanings.definition: The lower part of a hill or mountain, typically at the base.
meanings.sent1: The houses were nestled in the foothills, providing a beautiful view of the valley below.
meanings.sent2: We decided to hike up the foothills to get a better look at the surrounding landscape.
meanings.sent3: The goats in the foothills seemed to be playing a game of hide-and-seek among the rocks.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set behind the foothills, the sky turned a brilliant shade of orange.
meanings.sent5: The foothills stood like guardians at the entrance to the vast mountain range.

meanings.definition: A region of low hills at the base of a mountain range.
meanings.sent1: The small town was located in the foothills, offering a peaceful retreat from city life.
meanings.sent2: The foothills provided a gentle slope for beginners learning to ski before tackling the higher peaks.
meanings.sent3: The picnic in the foothills turned into a lively dance party under the stars.
meanings.sent4: The foothills resembled a sleeping giant, with its undulating curves and valleys.
meanings.sent5: The wildflowers carpeted the foothills in a riot of colors, attracting bees and butterflies alike.
